edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.inventory

Class BookTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.inventory.BookTest

  • public class BookTest
extends java.lang.Object
    The book test tries to create several books in order to test the exceptions of the book constructor and its related methods.
    Author:
    Marcus

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        The set up method instantiates the classes needed for the tests.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • testBook

        public void testBook()
        Test method for Book.Book(java.lang.String). The test method for the constructor ensures exceptions are thrown for invalid books and books without the proper format.

      • testGetInfo

        public void testGetInfo()
        Test method for Book.getInfo(). The test get info method ensures the book returns the correct information.

      • testToString

        public void testToString()
        Test method for Book.toString(). The method should place an asterisk in front of the book if no copies exist

      • testIsAvailable

        public void testIsAvailable()
        Test method for Book.isAvailable(). The is available method tests whether or not a book is available. It should return a simple boolean (true) for the first test book since it's available. It should return a false value for a book that's unavailable.

      • testBackToInventory

        public void testBackToInventory()
        Test method for Book.backToInventory(). The back to inventory method should increment the number of copies of book. The second test book (Blood Meridian) should be available after running this method.

      • testRemoveOneCopyFromInventory

        public void testRemoveOneCopyFromInventory()
        Test method for Book.removeOneCopyFromInventory(). The test remove a copy from inventory method should make a book with only 1 copy unavailable after running it. The test creates a book with one copy, and removes it to ensure its unavailable. Furthermore the test runs the exceptions to ensure they are thrown.

      • testCompareTo

        public void testCompareTo()
        Test method for Book.compareTo(edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_library.inventory.Book). The method tests books to ensure they compare properly. Two books with the same name should return 0. The method also tests a null pointer if the book of comparison is null. In order to ensure the private correctBooks method is working properly, we'll run several tests on books that start with "a" or "an" or "the" as well.
